1. Start by expressing your gratitude for giving you the opportunity to work at the company, and mention any specific projects or initiatives that were particularly enjoyable or impactful.
2. Give a clear and professional explanation of why you are leaving the company, whether it is due to a career change, relocation, personal reasons or other opportunities.
3. Thank your boss for the support they have provided during your time at the company, and ask if there is anything they can do to help facilitate a smooth transition.
4. Offer any assistance you can provide in finding and training your replacement, such as helping with job postings or scheduling interviews.
5. Close by expressing your best wishes for the company's future success, and thank them again for the opportunity to be a part of it.

Dear [Boss' name],
I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to take a moment to thank you for the opportunity to work at [company name] over the past [X number of years/months]. During my time here, I have been fortunate enough to be involved in [specific projects or initiatives that were enjoyable or impactful]. I want to express my gratitude for the support and encouragement you have provided me during my time at the company.
Unfortunately, I must inform you that I will be leaving the company on [date] due to [reason for departure]. I understand that this may cause some disruption and I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. If there is anything I can do to facilitate a smooth transition, please let me know.
I want to thank you again for being such an amazing boss and for the opportunity to be a part of [company name]. I wish the company continued success in the future.
Best regards,
[Your Name]
